required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pre-operative Focused Transthoracic Echocardiography for Prediction of Post-operative Cardiac Complications
clinical_study.official_title: Pre-operative Focused Transthoracic Echocardiography for Prediction of Post-operative Cardiac Complications

brief_summary.textblock: The extent focused transthoracic echocardiography when done pre-operatively to patients admitted for elective surgery and suspected to be at risk of cardiac disease specially the geriatric population can affect perioperative anesthetic management of these patients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline pre operative LVEDV to first day postoperative

intervention.description: TTE (Vivid I echocardiography machine General Electric Healthcare, Milwaukee, WI, USA) with a 3S-RS (1.5-3.6 MHz) transthoracic probe). was done by professional anesthesiologist following the :Hemodynamic Echocardiography Assessment in Real Time ( HEART) protocol. According to the clinical findings of TTE patients may be either free or have one or more of the following haemodynamic states normal, empty, vasodilated ,left ventricular systolic or diastolic failure, left ventricular systolic and diastolic failure, and right ventricular failure, valve stenosis or regurgitation of at least moderate severity

study_pop.textblock: Eligibility for participating in the study was assessed before assignment by the attending physician in the anesthesia clinic . Patients above 60 years of age ASAI and ASA II were included in the study unless history of cardiac disease, history of previous postoperative cardiac complications and symptoms or signs of cardiac diseases were found as theses patients were excluded from the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients above 60 years of age ASAI and ASA II were included
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of cardiac disease, history of previous postoperative cardiac complications and symptoms or signs of cardiac diseases.

overall_official.affiliation: Lecturer of Anesthesia, ICU and Pain Relief, South Egypt Cancer Institute.

facility.name: South Egypt Cancer Institute, Assiut University, Arab Republic of Egypt

responsible_party.investigator_title: Lecturer of Anesthesia, ICU and Pain Relief, South Egypt Cancer Institute, Assiut University.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
